--- title: "Invalid Geometries in Large Urban Areas Boundaries" from: markdown+emoji code-annotations: hover date: "2024-07-17" date-modified: "2024-07-17" categories: - spatial data - geometry - "importance: medium" issue-importance: medium status: "active" --- --- **Status**: {{< meta status >}} **Summary**: There are 3 invalid geometries in the Large Urban Areas boundaries dataset. **Expected Results**: The dataset should not contain any invalid geometries. *This repository can be opened in a web browser using Binder to explore all issues (under `issues` subfolder) interactively with `R/Rstudio`. Push the button >> [![Binder](https://mybinder.org/badge_logo.svg)](https://mybinder.org/v2/gh/e-kotov/mitma-data-issues/HEAD?urlpath=rstudio){target="_blank"}* ### Steps to Reproduce 1. **Load Data** Load libraries and define data files. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(sf) library(here) library(DT) gau_boundaries_data_file <- here("data/raw_data/v2/zonificacion/zonificacion_GAU/zonificacion_gaus.shp") gau_names_file <- here("data/raw_data/v2/zonificacion/zonificacion_GAU/nombres_gaus.csv") ``` ::: Load the data and join the Large Urban Areas names to the boundaries. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gau_boundaries <- read_sf(gau_boundaries_data_file) gau_names <- read_delim(gau_names_file, delim = "|", show_col_types = FALSE, name_repair = "unique_quiet") gau_boundaries <- gau_boundaries |> left_join(gau_names |> select(ID, name), by = c("ID")) ``` ::: 2. **Identify Invalid Geometries** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gau_boundaries_invalid <- !st_is_valid(gau_boundaries) ``` ::: ### Results 3. **Number of Invalid Geometries** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sum(gau_boundaries_invalid) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 3 ``` ::: ::: 4. **Names of Large Urban Areas with Invalid Geometries** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} DT::datatable(gau_boundaries[gau_boundaries_invalid,] |> st_drop_geometry()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ### Links to the original files ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} source(here("R/901-download-helpers.R")) files <- load_latest_v2_xml() # Filter relevant files relevant_files <- files |> filter(basename(local_path) %in% basename(c(gau_boundaries_data_file, gau_names_file)) ) # Create HTML links relevant_files <- relevant_files |> mutate(target_url = paste0("", target_url, "")) # Render the DT table with links datatable(relevant_files, escape = FALSE, options = list(pageLength = 5)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: :::
